entry.title: Our new report finds that in an unprecedented move to protect...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Our new report finds that in an unprecedented move to protect public health, Sheriffs across the state worked to safely decrease jail populations with 6,000 fewer people sleeping in jail each night & over 20,000 more people living free each month. Read the full report: http://bit.ly/371MTZt

entry.title: In three months, jail populations dropped to levels not seen in...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

In three months, jail populations dropped to levels not seen in almost thirty years. COVID-19 jail depopulation has shown that we know how to quickly, dramatically & safely free thousands of people from behind bars. The time to build a better CO is now. Read our report: https://aclu-co.org/…/aclu_decarcerationreport_100720_final…

entry.title: In Colorado, you are eligible to vote if you: ✅ Will be 18...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

In Colorado, you are eligible to vote if you:

✅ Will be 18 years of age or older at the time of the election
✅ Are a U.S. citizen
✅ Have resided in Colorado 22 days immediately before the election...
✅ If you are absent while in military service or while attending college, you are still eligible to vote in the state of Colorado

For more info on voter eligibility, visit https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/FAQs/VoterRegistrationFAQ.html

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: With federal protections for reproductive rights now...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

With federal protections for reproductive rights now precariously uncertain, it is more urgent than ever that the states safeguard access to abortion care. But in Colorado, that access is under a real, imminent threat: Proposition 115, a measure that would ban abortion later in pregnancy is on the ballot this year.

This is all Coloradans are asking for: to control our own bodies, and our own futures. With Justice Ginsburg now gone, it falls on all of us to honor her legacy by continuing that fight. In Colorado, that means voting “NO” on Proposition 115.

Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.

aclu.org

The Right to Abortion is on the Ballot in Colorado This November

Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.Proposition 115 shows no compassion for what families face in unimaginably complicated circumstances and takes away the ability of doctors to provide the best medical care for their patients.

entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

🗳️Colorado Voters🗳️: ballots are being mailed to all registered voters TODAY. Here are some actions you can take to ensure you receive a ballot:

1. Make sure your voter registration is up to date.
2. Double check your mailing address.

...

More info at: https://www.sos.state.co.us/voter/pages/pub/home.xhtml

entry.title: Happening now: National Day of Action to call and text with the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Happening now: National Day of Action to call and text with the #NoOn115 campaign. Every voter we talk to brings us closer to stopping the abortion ban on Colorado’s ballot.

Abortion Access For All - No On 115 was live.

entry.title: If Proposition 115 passes in Colorado, it will ban abortion...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If Proposition 115 passes in Colorado, it will ban abortion later in pregnancy — and abortion access as we know it. Join us at 4MT/6ET for a national day of action and rally. Hear from legendary advocates on what's at stake and how you can help. Register: http://votenoon115.com/NDArally

entry.title: TODAY: You don't want to miss Abortion Access For All - No...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

TODAY: You don't want to miss Abortion Access For All - No On 115’s National Day of Action with a fire lineup: including Dolores Huerta, Cecile Richards, Louise Melling, and Lizz Winstead. It’s time to defeat Colorado’s abortion ban. Register NOW to join & help mobilize voters: http://voteno115.com/ND

entry.title: Historically, police were created as slave patrols to catch...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Historically, police were created as slave patrols to catch those who were enslaved seeking liberation. This system hasn’t reformed from its racist origins. It’s time to reimagine something different.

Join us: https://fb.me/e/18pJ1vyTr

entry.title: These races and ballot issues will have an immediate effect on...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

These races and ballot issues will have an immediate effect on the lives of Coloradans and set precedent for the entire country. It is critical for all voters to be armed with the facts and able to educate others in their community.

Vote like your rights depend on it. Get out the vote.

The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado released its guidance on what rights-minded voters should consider the upcoming ballot.

coloradopolitics.com

ACLU Colorado releases voter's guide

The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado released its guidance on what rights-minded voters should consider the upcoming ballot.The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado released its guidance on what rights-minded voters should consider the upcoming ballot.

entry.title: ICE can never be trusted to protect human life, especially in...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

ICE can never be trusted to protect human life, especially in Aurora. This facility is dangerous and unsafe — those are the facts. ICE shouldn't be praised, it must be dismantled. Evalin-Ali Mandza and Kamyar Samimi died in ICE custody. Say their names.

This facility has been operating in our community for three decades under presidents from both parties. Unfortunately, Congressman Jason Crow has chosen to turn this service into a cheap political …

denverpost.com

Steve House: Aurora’s ICE facility is a safe, clean and necessary facility — despite what my opponent says

This facility has been operating in our community for three decades under presidents from both parties. Unfortunately, Congressman Jason Crow has chosen to turn this service into a cheap political …This facility has been operating in our community for three decades under presidents from both parties. Unfortunately, Congressman Jason Crow has chosen to turn this service into a cheap political …

entry.title: NOW LAUNCHING: Today we released our 2020 Voter Guide to help...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

NOW LAUNCHING: Today we released our 2020 Voter Guide to help people better understand candidates’ positions on critical civil liberties issues & what ballot initiatives to look out for. For more go to www.aclu-co.org/voterguide and vote like your rights depend on it.

This is an all-mail election. All ballots must be received, not postmarked, by 7 p.m. on November 3. Mail your ballot no later than October 26 or return your ballot at a drop box.

aclu-covoterguide.org

ACLU Voters

This is an all-mail election. All ballots must be received, not postmarked, by 7 p.m. on November 3. Mail your ballot no later than October 26 or return your ballot at a drop box.Learn MoreThis is an all-mail election. All ballots must be received, not postmarked, by 7 p.m. on November 3. Mail your ballot no later than October 26 or return your ballot at a drop box.Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: The deadline to be counted in the 2020 Census has been extended...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The deadline to be counted in the 2020 Census has been extended through Oct 31 — for now. But don't delay, go to http://2020Census.gov to fill it out yours today. When it comes to being counted and represented, there's no time to waste.

A federal judge has ordered the Census Bureau to keep counting households for now after finding the agency made an "egregious" violation of an earlier order by tweeting a "target" end date of Oct. 5.

npr.org

After 'Egregious' Violation, Judge Orders Census To Count Through Oct. 31 For Now

A federal judge has ordered the Census Bureau to keep counting households for now after finding the agency made an "egregious" violation of an earlier order by tweeting a "target" end date of Oct. 5.A federal judge has ordered the Census Bureau to keep counting households for now after finding the agency made an "egregious" violation of an earlier order by tweeting a "target" end date of Oct. 5.

entry.title: All abortion bans — whether in Alabama or Colorado — are...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

All abortion bans — whether in Alabama or Colorado — are political attacks. They are not about health or medicine. They are about controlling women and taking away decision-making power. This is evidenced by the fact that Proposition 115 is being pushed by many of the same politicians and groups who have tried — and failed — to ban abortion altogether in Colorado every year for the last decade.

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was one of American Civil Liberties Union’s (ACLU) most illustrious alumni. She founded the ACLU’s Women’s Rights Project and in the weekend following her passing, the

coloradopolitics.com

All abortion bans are about controlling women

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was one of American Civil Liberties Union’s (ACLU) most illustrious alumni. entry.title: ¡SÍ, SE PUEDE! Organized in 1962 by Dolores Huerta, Cesar...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

¡SÍ, SE PUEDE!

Organized in 1962 by Dolores Huerta, Cesar Chavez, and Gilbert Padilla, the United Farm Workers union fights exploitative practices toward farmworkers in the US. Its work continues today.
